Expressing support for designation of
		  August 2013 as

term.#text:
Blue Star Mothers of America
		  Month

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted
			 the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: That the

term.#text:
Blue Star
			 Mothers of America Month

text.#text: supports the designation of

encourages all citizens to take time during
			 the month to reflect and honor the dedication and sacrifice of the mothers of
			 members of the United States Armed Forces and celebrate the rich history and
			 contributions they have made to the great Nation.

Whereas Blue Star Mothers of America, Inc. was founded as
			 a patriotic service organization on February 2, 1942, with the purpose of
			 uniting mothers with sons or daughters in the United States Armed
			 Forces;

Whereas persons eligible for membership in the Blue Star
			 Mothers of America include any woman who filled the role of birthmother,
			 adoptive mother, step-mother, foster-mother, grandmother, legal Guardian of a
			 service member at any time in that service members’ life who is currently
			 serving in any branch of the United States Armed Forces, or has served and been
			 discharged;

Whereas the work of the Blue Star Mothers of America
			 includes—

supporting members
			 of the United States Armed Forces and veterans;

maintaining
			 allegiance to the United States;

honoring those
			 families whose children have died in service to the Nation;

fostering true
			 democracy;

assisting in
			 homeland security;

upholding the
			 United States principles of freedom, justice, and equal rights; and

defending the
			 United States from all enemies, foreign and domestic;

Whereas the dedication of Blue Star Mothers of America is
			 increasingly important with over 11,000 active members in 42 States of the
			 United States with sons and daughters serving in the United States Air Force,
			 Army, Marine Corps, Navy, and Coast Guard;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for display by families who have
			 members serving in the United States Armed Forces during any period of war or
			 armed hostilities the Nation may be engaged in for the duration of such
			 hostilities;

text.#text:
Whereas the Blue Star Service Flag is the official banner
			 authorized by the

Whereas the loyalty, dedication, sacrifice, and hard work
			 of the devoted members of Blue Star Mothers of America merit the utmost
			 respect, acknowledgment, and recognition of the public; and

term.#text: Blue Star Mothers of America Month

text.#text:
Whereas August 2013 would be an appropriate month to
			 designate as

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 293 IH: Expressing support for designation of August 2013 as Blue Star Mothers of America Month.
